title: The canonical bijection from the finite ordinals

blocks.name: ciomnn
blocks.content: Syntax for the canonical bijection from _om onto NN0.

blocks.name: df-bj-iomnn
blocks.content: Definition of the canonical bijection from ` ( _om u. { _om } ) ` onto ` ( NN0 u. { pinfty } ) ` . To understand this definition, recall that set.mm constructs reals as couples whose first component is a prereal and second component is the zero prereal (in order that one have ` RR C_ CC ` ), that prereals are equivalence classes of couples of positive reals, the latter are Dedekind cuts of positive rationals, which are equivalence classes of positive ordinals. In partiular, we take the successor ordinal at the beginning and subtract one at the end since the intermediate systems contain only (strictly) positive numbers. Note the similarity with ~ df-bj-fractemp but we did not use the present definition there since we wanted to have defined ` pinfty ` first. See ~ bj-iomnnom for its value at ` pinfty ` . TODO: define ` |- NN0 = ( iomnn " _om ) ` (and then ` |- NN = ( NN0 \ NN ) ` ) and prove ` |- ( iomnn |`` _om ) : _om -1-1-onto-> NN0 ` and that this bijection is an ordered rig isomorphism. Prove ` |- ( iomnn |`` _om ) = rec ( ( x e. RR |-> ( x + 1 ) ) , 0 ) ` and ` |- ( iomnn `` (/) ) = 0 ` . (Contributed by BJ, 18-Feb-2023.) The precise definition is irrelevant and should generally not be used. (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-imafv
blocks.content: If the direct image of a singleton under any of two functions is the same, then the values of these function at the corresponding point agree. (Contributed by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-imafv(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1))), wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c2, c1)))
} = {
  3eqtr4g(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c2, c1), cuni(cab(hs0, wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0))))), cuni(cab(hs0, wceq(cima(c2, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0))))), wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1))))
  unieqd(cab(hs0, wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0)))), cab(hs0, wceq(cima(c2, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0)))), wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1))))
  abbidv(hs0, wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1))), wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0))), wceq(cima(c2, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0))))
  eqeq1(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1)), csn(cv(hs0)))
  dffv4(hs0, c0, c1)
  dffv4(hs0, c2, c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1))))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: bj-funun
blocks.content: Value of a function expressed as a union of two functions at a point not in the domain of one of them. (Contributed by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-funun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c2, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cun(c2, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(c1, cdm(c3))))
} = {
  syl(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c2, c1)), wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1))))
  eqtrd(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cima(c2, csn(c1)), cun(cima(c2, csn(c1)), cima(c3, csn(c1))), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cun(cima(c2, csn(c1)), cima(c3, csn(c1)))), wceq(c0, cun(c2, c3)))
  syl6eq(cima(c0, csn(c1)), cun(cima(c2, csn(c1)), cima(c3, csn(c1))), cima(cun(c2, c3), csn(c1)), wceq(c0, cun(c2, c3)))
  imaeq1(c0, cun(c2, c3), csn(c1))
  imaundir(c2, c3, csn(c1))
  syl(w0, wceq(cun(cima(c2, csn(c1)), cima(c3, csn(c1))), cima(c2, csn(c1))), wceq(cima(c3, csn(c1)), emptycls))
  syl(w0, wceq(cima(c3, csn(c1)), emptycls), wn(wcel(c1, cdm(c3))))
  ndmima(c1, c3)
  syl6eq(cun(cima(c2, csn(c1)), cima(c3, csn(c1))), cima(c2, csn(c1)), cun(cima(c2, csn(c1)), emptycls), wceq(cima(c3, csn(c1)), emptycls))
  uneq2(cima(c3, csn(c1)), emptycls, cima(c2, csn(c1)))
  un0(cima(c2, csn(c1)))
  bj-imafv(c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: bj-fununsn1
blocks.content: Value of a function expressed as a union of a function and a singleton on a couple (with disjoint domain) at a point not equal to the first component of that couple. (Contributed by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: bj-fununsn2
blocks.content: Value of a function expressed as a union of a function and a singleton on a couple (with disjoint domain) at the first component of that couple. (Contributed by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-fununsn2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cun(c3, csn(cop(c1, c2)))))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(c1, cdm(c3))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c0, c1), c2, cfv(csn(cop(c1, c2)), c1), w0)
  bj-funun(c0, c1, csn(cop(c1, c2)), c3, w0)
  syl6eq(c0, cun(csn(cop(c1, c2)), c3), cun(c3, csn(cop(c1, c2))), w0)
  uncom(c3, csn(cop(c1, c2)))
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(cfv(csn(cop(c1, c2)), c1), c2), wcel(c1, c4), wcel(c2, c5))
  fvsng(c1, c4, c2, c5)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-fununsn2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)= c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c3 ‚ãÉ { < c1, c2 > }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí ¬¨ c1 ‚àà dom(c3))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c5)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0 ` c1), c2, ({ < c1, c2 > } ` c1), w0)
  bj-funun(c0, c1, { < c1, c2 > }, c3, w0)
  syl6eq(c0, ({ < c1, c2 > } ‚ãÉ c3), (c3 ‚ãÉ { < c1, c2 > }), w0)
  uncom(c3, { < c1, c2 > })
  syl2anc(w0, ({ < c1, c2 > } ` c1)= c2, c1 ‚àà c4, c2 ‚àà c5)
  fvsng(c1, c4, c2, c5)
}

blocks.name: bj-fvsnun1
blocks.content: The value of a function with one of its ordered pairs replaced, at arguments other than the replaced one. (Contributed by NM, 23-Sep-2007.) Put in deduction form and remove two sethood hypotheses. (Revised by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.)

blocks.name: bj-fvsnun2
blocks.content: The value of a function with one of its ordered pairs replaced, at the replaced ordered pair. See also ~ fvsnun2 . (Contributed by NM, 23-Sep-2007.) Put in deduction form. (Revised by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-fvsnun2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cun(cres(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c1))), csn(cop(c1, c2)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c6))
} = {
  bj-fununsn2(c0, c1, c2, cres(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c1))), c5, c6, w0)
  ssneldd(c1, cdm(cres(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c1)))), cdif(c4, csn(c1)), w0)
  a1i(w0, wss(cdm(cres(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c1)))), cdif(c4, csn(c1))))
  eqsstri(cdm(cres(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c1)))), cdif(c4, csn(c1)), cin(cdif(c4, csn(c1)), cdm(c3)))
  dmres(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c1)))
  inss1(cdif(c4, csn(c1)), cdm(c3))
  neldifsnd(c1, c4, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-fvsnun2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)= c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =((c3 |`(c4 \ { c1 }))‚ãÉ { < c1, c2 > }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c6)
} = {
  bj-fununsn2(c0, c1, c2, (c3 |`(c4 \ { c1 })), c5, c6, w0)
  ssneldd(c1, dom((c3 |`(c4 \ { c1 }))), (c4 \ { c1 }), w0)
  a1i(w0, dom((c3 |`(c4 \ { c1 })))‚äÜ(c4 \ { c1 }))
  eqsstri(dom((c3 |`(c4 \ { c1 }))), (c4 \ { c1 }), ((c4 \ { c1 })‚ãÇ dom(c3)))
  dmres(c3, (c4 \ { c1 }))
  inss1((c4 \ { c1 }), dom(c3))
  neldifsnd(c1, c4, w0)
}

blocks.name: bj-fvmptunsn1
blocks.content: Value of a function expressed as a union of a mapsto expression and a singleton on a couple (with disjoint domain) at the first component of that couple. (Contributed by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-fvmptunsn1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cun(cmpt(s0, c3, c4), csn(cop(c1, c2)))))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(c1, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c6))
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  bj-fununsn2(c0, c1, c2, cmpt(s0, c3, c4), c5, c6, w0)
  nsyl(w0, wcel(c1, cdm(cmpt(s0, c3, c4))), wcel(c1, c3))
  sseli(c1, cdm(cmpt(s0, c3, c4)), c3)
  dmmptss(s0, cmpt(s0, c3, c4), c3, c4)
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c3, c4))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-fvmptunsn1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)= c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4)‚ãÉ { < c1, c2 > }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí ¬¨ c1 ‚àà c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  bj-fununsn2(c0, c1, c2, (s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4), c5, c6, w0)
  nsyl(w0, c1 ‚àà dom((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4)), c1 ‚àà c3)
  sseli(c1, dom((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4)), c3)
  dmmptss(s0, (s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4), c3, c4)
  eqid((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4))
}

blocks.name: bj-fvmptunsn2
blocks.content: Value of a function expressed as a union of a mapsto expression and a singleton on a couple (with disjoint domain) at a point in the domain of the mapsto construction. (Contributed by BJ, 18-Mar-2023.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-fvmptunsn2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cun(cmpt(s0, c3, c4), csn(cop(c5, c6)))))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(c5, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c7))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), wceq(c4, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c0, c1), c2, cfv(cmpt(s0, c3, c4), c1), w0)
  bj-fununsn1(c0, c1, cmpt(s0, c3, c4), c5, c6, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wn(wceq(c1, c5)), wcel(c1, c3), wn(wcel(c5, c3)))
  nelneq(c1, c3, c5)
  fvmptd(s0, cmpt(s0, c3, c4), c1, c2, c3, c4, c7, w0)
  eqidd(cmpt(s0, c3, c4), w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-fvmptunsn2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)= c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4)‚ãÉ { < c5, c6 > }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí ¬¨ c5 ‚àà c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 = c1)‚Üí c4 = c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0 ` c1), c2, ((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4)` c1), w0)
  bj-fununsn1(c0, c1, (s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4), c5, c6, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, ¬¨ c1 = c5, c1 ‚àà c3, ¬¨ c5 ‚àà c3)
  nelneq(c1, c3, c5)
  fvmptd(s0, (s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4), c1, c2, c3, c4, c7, w0)
  eqidd((s0 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶ c4), w0)
}

blocks.name: bj-iomnnom
blocks.content: The canonical bijection from ` ( _om u. { _om } ) ` onto ` ( NN0 u. { pinfty } ) ` maps ` _om ` to ` pinfty ` . (Contributed by BJ, 18-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-iomnnom() {
  |- wceq(cfv(ciomnn, com), cpinfty)
} = {
  mptru(wceq(cfv(ciomnn, com), cpinfty))
  bj-fvmptunsn1(hs0, ciomnn, com, cpinfty, com, cop(cec(cop(crab(hs1, cnq, wbr(cv(hs1), cltq, cop(csuc(cv(hs0)), c1o))), c1p), cer), c0r), universe, cccbar, wtru)
  a1i(wtru, wceq(ciomnn, cun(cmpt(hs0, com, cop(cec(cop(crab(hs1, cnq, wbr(cv(hs1), cltq, cop(csuc(cv(hs0)), c1o))), c1p), cer), c0r)), csn(cop(com, cpinfty)))))
  df-bj-iomnn(hs0, hs1)
  a1i(wtru, wn(wcel(com, com)))
  elirr(com)
  a1i(wtru, wcel(com, universe))
  omex()
  a1i(wtru, wcel(cpinfty, cccbar))
  bj-pinftyccb()
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-iomnnom() {
  ‚ä¢ (iomnn ` _om)= pinfty
} = {
  mptru((iomnn ` _om)= pinfty)
  bj-fvmptunsn1(hs0, ciomnn, com, cpinfty, com, <[< { hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñö+ | hs1[<]< suc(hs0), 1o > }, 1 >]~, 0 >, universe, cccbar, wtru)
  a1i(wtru, iomnn =((hs0 ‚àà _om ‚Ü¶ <[< { hs1 ‚àà ‚Ñö+ | hs1[<]< suc(hs0), 1o > }, 1 >]~, 0 >)‚ãÉ { < _om, pinfty > }))
  df-bj-iomnn(hs0, hs1)
  a1i(wtru, ¬¨ _om ‚àà _om)
  elirr(com)
  a1i(wtru, _om ‚àà ùïå)
  omex()
  a1i(wtru, pinfty ‚àà CCbar)
  bj-pinftyccb()
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}
